Generation IV.Diamond: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
Generation IV.HeartGold: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

Generation VI.X: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Generation VI.Y: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. Floatzel carries people as if it were a rubber raft.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.

Generation IX.Scarlet: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
Generation IX.Violet: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.
